description:
JSinSA 2016 conference - Johannesburg, South Africa 

An annual gathering of JavaScript developers at the tip of Africa.

Talk Summary:
Given how difficult it is to build performant hybrid mobile apps using web technologies for various platforms. React Native takes a different approach without promising you to write once and running everywhere. In this talk through how to build a React Native app using the shared knowledge but targeting different platforms. 
In this talk I will walk through building a React Native app as we try to see how it solves this problem. Will cover the very basics, from how to get started all the way to avoid common performance pitfalls.

Speaker Bio:
Software Developer with a wide range of expertise and interests around, designing and delivering of modern solutions using tools that best fit. He has worked across different stacks building Web Applications and Mobile apps. 
Lately, he's been spending most of his free time journeying into the world of data analysis with Python. He hopes to become a "Data Scientist" one day ;) 
Currently at Databuild, building awesome things there.

Video done by:
https://www.facebook.com/William-Morrison-VideoPhotographer-1762126460674716/

Sponsored by Google Africa.
title: Getting started with React Native by Kudakwashe Murungu
